item.title: Player.Java
item.dc:creator: @zzzzzzzzzz zzzzzzzzzz
item.description:
@zzzzzzzzzz wrote:

so

for (int i = 0; i < playerItems.length; i++) { //Setting player items playerItems[i] = {995,1265,1351,1291,882,841,316}; } for (int i = 0; i<playerItemsN.length; i++) { //Setting Item amounts playerItemsN[i] = {15000,1,1,1,100,1,100}; }
Replace it with

playerItems = {995, 1265, 1351, 1291, 882, 841, 316}; playerItemsN = {15000, 1, 1, 1, 100, 1, 100};

so it will look like this
playerItems = {995, 1265, 1351, 1291, 882, 841, 316};
playerItemsN = {15000, 1, 1, 1, 100, 1, 100};

@xx_qwertyuiop_xx wrote:

for (int i = 0; i < playerItems.length; i++) { //Setting player items
	playerItems[i] = 0;
}
for (int i = 0; i<playerItemsN.length; i++) { //Setting Item amounts
	playerItemsN[i] = 0;
}

Edit it to your liking.

item.title: Player.Java
item.dc:creator: @zzzzzzzzzz zzzzzzzzzz
item.description:
@zzzzzzzzzz wrote:

i know thats where u change when they first log in they get set amout of items how do i add them there wasent an example there so idk

[code] // some remarks: one map region is 8x8
// a 7-bit (i.e. 128) value thus ranges over 16 such regions
// the active area of 104x104 is comprised of 13x13 such regions, i.e. from
// the center region that is 6 regions in each direction (notice the magical 6
// appearing also in map region arithmetics…)
public int combat = 0;
public Player(int _playerId) {
playerId = _playerId;
//playerName = “player”+playerId;
playerRights = 0; //player rights

	for (int i = 0; i < playerItems.length; i++) { //Setting player items
		playerItems[i] = 0;
	}
	for (int i = 0; i<playerItemsN.length; i++) { //Setting Item amounts
		playerItemsN[i] = 0;
	}

	for (int i=0; i<playerLevel.length; i++) { //Setting Levels
		if (i == 3) {
			playerLevel[i] = 1;
			playerXP[i] = 10;
		} else {
			playerLevel[i] = 1;
			playerXP[i] = 0;
		}
	}[/code]

Read full topic
